name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I appreciate this recognition from @StuDoesAmerica on @glennbeck’s radio program as the best state in the nation for our response to Covid-19, the economy and freedom.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Like everyone, I was thrilled to see the progress of @jonhawkins57 as he joined the legislative session by video after battling COVID 19 for the past 7 weeks. I have known the Hawkins family for 50 years and Jon’s father Ron, one of my dearest friends, since we were age 7.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Today is a good day. Glad to see Congress provide for COVID-19 relief funding - and pass the Navajo Utah Water Rights Settlement Act. #utpol  https://t.co/k71uOVY4Dz

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Tune in to our regular weekly COVID briefing at 11:30 am. You can stream at:  https://t.co/D4VC3XsnDM #utpol #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Though we rightly concentrate on mortality rates for coronavirus, an oft-overlooked aspect of the virus is the long-term effects. We are learning more every day about the extended long-term effects and dangers of COVID. We must take this pandemic seriously.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The way we celebrate Thanksgiving this week will have a huge impact on the trajectory on the outbreak of COVID-19 in Utah. The safest celebration is only with those who live under your roof.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We are asking Utahns to do this because we know the more people you gather with, the greater your risk for contracting the virus. We cannot beat COVID if we celebrate the holidays as we normally do.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We absolutely need to stop this alarming trend. We know that about 4.5 to 5 percent of people who test positive for COVID-19 will end up in the hospital. If we continue doubling the number of cases, we will continue the surge into our hospitals, which are already overwhelmed.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Today is yet another concerning day for COVID-19 spread in Utah. If you look back in time, it took 9.5 weeks to get from 35,000 to 70,000 cases. It took just 6.5 weeks to get from 70,000 to 140,000. This reality has had a real effect on our hospitals. #utpol #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: One easy step you can take to help our fight against COVID-19 is getting your flu shot. With influenza season beginning, it's important we work to preserve hospital space. By getting vaccinated, you are protecting your own health and the health of our community. #HealthyInUtah  https://t.co/83hLJRDwPl

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Great thread on the Q&A we hosted with the media this morning about our updated COVID-19 response. For more information on the new State of Emergency and restrictions, visit  https://t.co/4yUgrOIVcI #utcovid19 #utpol

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Due to the alarming rate of COVID infections within our state, tonight I issued a new state of emergency with several critical changes to our response. These changes are not shutting down our economy, but are absolutely necessary to save lives and hospital capacity. #utpol  https://t.co/BuSNBsCbiz

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The truth is, the more tests we administer, the faster we can loosen restrictions. By forgoing testing when you're exposed or feeling symptoms, you may be unknowingly contributing to the spread of COVID in Utah. If you meet the requirements for testing, don’t delay. #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: @CDCDirector confirmed that masks work. Wear one anytime you are near someone who doesn’t live in your house. Many who are infected with COVID-19 are asymptomatic and never know they have the virus.  Wearing a mask is a scientifically proven way to prevent additional infections.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Grateful to meet with Dr. Birx and @CDCDirector today. For some time now, our data has shown that social gatherings are the main source of COVID-19 spread. Dr. Birx and Redfield confirmed this pattern is nationwide.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Utah is in a very serious situation. COVID-19 is the most devastating when hospitals are overwhelmed and unable to provide good care to everyone who needs it. We have seen this in Italy. We have seen this in New York. We could see this in Utah if things do not change.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: As we near the end of the month, I want to remind Utahns that rent relief is available. Our Housing Assistance Program can help renters unable to pay rent/utilities due to COVID-19. Visit  https://t.co/9GyIhcVFn8 to find out if you qualify.  https://t.co/sypk2XLQQt

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: As the spread of COVID-19 has accelerated in Utah, our hospitals are experiencing mounting pressure. I know most have not personally experienced the harrowing reality in our ICUs, but it takes all of us to reverse the trends. #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Due to the high prevalence of COVID-19 in Utah, Monday’s Economic and Energy Summit will be virtual-only.  https://t.co/vFauZ6cKyw

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Today marked a somber record for case counts in Utah. I am deeply concerned COVID exhaustion is at an all-time high. I want to remind everyone that by public health order, masks are required in 21 counties. Now more than ever, we need you to follow our guidance. #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I ask Utahns to not just lean on your own experience during this pandemic. Learn from the science and examples you see. You don’t have to wait until you personally experience a crisis with COVID-19 before you realize you could have done more.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We don’t dispute that most people won’t die from COVID-19 and know many who get infected won’t have severe symptoms. BUT, we know many people with coronavirus will have long term impacts on their heart and lungs. Already, too many Utahns have succumbed to the virus.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: A reminder to all Utahns: Casual social gatherings are frequent sources of spread for COVID-19. Under our new transmission index, we ask people in high or moderate (until after 10/29) transmission areas to limit these gatherings to 10 or fewer. #utcovid19  https://t.co/LPKfEBs5MX

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: ICYMI: Today the state entered our 2-week “circuit breaker” in order to reduce the spread of COVID-19 cases as we transition into our new Transmission Index framework. Learn more at:  https://t.co/PSrxAHIOph   #utpol #utcovid19  https://t.co/N7gzeOp72R

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Yesterday we took important progressive steps in our state’s fight against COVID. Our new approach focuses on data-driven decisions along three key metrics. Read more about our new framework and associated guidelines here:  https://t.co/PSrxAHIOph #utpol

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The new system also puts emphasis on controlling spread at casual social gatherings — this is when you're getting together when you're family and friends. These are a significant source of COVID-19 transmission in Utah.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The new COVID-19 Transmission Index zeroes in on adapting behaviors that will get us the most bang for our buck in curbing coronavirus infections.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The new system is based on the Transmission Index, which calculates the level of COVID-19 transmission in each county by analyzing three data points - percent positivity of tests, cases per 100,000, and hospital capacity.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: You and your families deserve good health, more normalcy, and certainty. As a state government, we owe it to you to make critical decisions about the COVID-19 pandemic based on critical health data — not based on fear, and certainly not based on politics.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We are utilizing 15.8% of our ICU beds to treat COVID-19 patients, more than double what we were before, and our total ICU utilization is at 69.6%. This leaves our hospitals precariously close to being unable to treat COVID and non-COVID patients in need of critical care.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Following weeks of surging cases, I will join representatives from the @UtahDepOfHealth in announcing major changes to Utah’s COVID-19 guidance system. This will include new restrictions.   Stream here live at 1:30:  https://t.co/JGxSBaymOg

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Though several months have elapsed since the emergence of COVID-19 in Utah, volunteer efforts are still needed. Our great state has frequently been the best in the nation for volunteering and charity. Now is no different. Find opportunities to help at:  https://t.co/7Q0OBh87ZF

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: ICYMI: I was grateful to have Dr. Bishop of Utah Valley Hospital lend his perspective during our press conference last week. As Dr. Bishop says, COVID-19 is a miserable and persistent disease, and I ask Utahns to do their part in slowing the spread.  https://t.co/IgNP8JXvjh

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I am additionally announcing a $2 million grant program to help small businesses continue to pay employees who are required to quarantine or isolate due to a positive COVID-19 test or exposure. Learn more about the grant at  https://t.co/DlAuUlq6TE

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We are also meeting with hospitals to improve our testing network. Thanks to our medical professionals, testing has improved and hospital stays for COVID are shorter than they were several months ago.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Utah’s COVID-19 response team has made updates to the  https://t.co/OHttfLwTcD case count dashboard. We are committed to ensuring transparency in our numbers and providing Utahns with the most accurate data. Learn more about interpreting the data here:  https://t.co/agcldwOlHX

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: This is a wise decision by members of the Utah County Commission. A countywide mask requirement will help slow the spread of COVID-19 in hotspots across Utah County. We encourage all to wear masks - remember, my mask protects you and yours protects me.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I will be holding a press briefing today with members of our Unified Command leadership team at 12:15 to discuss important updates to our COVID-19 response. You can live stream the briefing here:  https://t.co/JGxSBaymOg #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: This week, the state has seen a troubling spike in COVID cases after a promising August. Today’s case numbers are the highest single-day count since the beginning of the pandemic. #UtahCOVID19 #utpol

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: If you're experiencing any of the 6 key symptoms or have confirmed exposure to someone with COVID-19, don’t delay getting tested. Utah has the capacity to greatly increase our testing output. For questions on testing eligibility, cost, or locations, visit  https://t.co/K2jsknmH5E  https://t.co/u69EhzCGX1

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We have published information about how we certify COVID-19 deaths in Utah on the latest updates page of  https://t.co/OHttfLwTcD. The bottom line is that Utah is taking great care, using our state experts, to present accurate data to the public.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Recently we’ve also had some misinterpret some CDC data related to deaths from COVID-19. Without a doubt, we know coronavirus has caused more than 400 deaths in Utah and over 177,000 in the United States.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We are mindful of COVID-19 cases appearing in various areas of the state, including in our schools. This is expected with many returning to the classroom. Our health departments are committed to providing the best health guidance so schools can effectively reduce outbreaks. #uted

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: La comunidad latina es importante para Utah y reconocemos esta comunidad se ha visto afectada más que otras por COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Please remember there are some people who have underlying health conditions who cannot tolerate the effects of COVID-19. We wear our masks for them. We maintain physical distancing for them.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: If you are experiencing COVID symptoms, I ask that you get tested. Testing plays an important role in keeping our communities safe by helping us track the spread of the virus. Every positive test gives us a chance to provide specific health guidance to that individual.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The goal of our COVID response is to protect lives and livelihoods. While Utah has one of the lowest mortality rates and the lowest jobless rate in the nation, we still have a lot of work to do to get through this pandemic. Together, we can preserve life and rebuild our economy.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The only way to defeat COVID-19 is by working together. Let’s not criticize others. We can build each other up instead of tearing down. Working together, being a good neighbor, and following sound science is the right thing to do.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We have also been learning that some are delaying important care and avoiding hospital visits due to concerns over COVID-19. Our hospitals are doing a miraculous job enacting protocols that keep all patients and caregivers safe. Please do not delay your medical care.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: For those with questions about the cost of receiving a COVID-19 test, most people should not have to pay to get one.  https://t.co/vCi2LdEIrh

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I encourage Utahns who may have questions about the efficacy and safety of masks to read this overview of the science behind their use. The evidence is clear — masks reduce the spread of COVID-19 and are safe to wear. #MaskUpUtah   https://t.co/crf9OpDGsO

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Guidance from @UtahDepOfHealth now clarifies that students and teachers should follow standard quarantine practices when exposed to COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Though we can’t eliminate all risk, we know we must provide a school environment which makes our teachers, students, and parents feel comfortable and safe. We are working to provide further guidance to help schools respond when someone tests positive for COVID.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We know the best way to slow the spread of COVID is to stay home if you’re sick and maintain a physical distance and wear a mask when outside your home. Wearing a mask should not be political. It’s good science, good sense, and shows respect for those around you.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: In the Declaration of Independence, our founders pledged to one another their lives, their fortunes and their sacred honor. As Americans and Utahns, we can take the same pledge, to protect one another from COVID.  #4thofJuly  https://t.co/It2s0o4sis

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: While we celebrate this weekend, let's do so safely. COVID-19 has changed how we interact & celebrate. Gather in smaller groups, hold events outside, practice physical distancing, and use masks. Be especially careful around older family members and those at higher risk.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Dr. Dunn’s internal memo raises alarm about the increasing COVID-19 cases in Utah. I appreciate her analysis and share many of her concerns. We will work to stem this tide, but I have no plans to shut down Utah’s economy.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: As we see COVID-19 cases spike, I urge all Utahns to use face coverings. I wear face masks every day. I know it can look and feel a little different. But data shows it slows the spread of this pernicious virus. #StayStrong Utah.   https://t.co/snc1Ux5xYA

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Though our COVID-related economic downturn has not been as deep as most states, thousands of Utahns still have been directly threatened by this recession. But our current position should provide hope that we can recover quicker than other states to an even better place.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Due to the COVID-related economic downturn, our consensus revenue numbers for fiscal years 2020 and 2021 show a deficit of $93 million in one-time funding and a deficit of $757 million in ongoing funding in the general and education funds.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We so appreciate working with @NNPrezNez on efforts to combat COVID-19. Our hearts go out to all of our Navajo friends who have been impacted by this awful virus.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: It will also help Utah populations that have been disproportionately impacted by COVID-19: those with high health risks and those in our multicultural community.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: This morning, members of Utah's Incident Command met with minority party leadership in the House and Senate. Grateful to all of our legislators for their commitment and partnership in the fight against COVID-19. #utcovid19  https://t.co/JgqVual0sK

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: .@CDCgov recommends wearing face masks in public, particularly because asymptomatic spread of COVID-19 can occur.    https://t.co/EFtfTo4Zf7

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Studies show that wearing masks - even homemade ones - dramatically decreases the spread of COVID-19. Wear a mask when around others to prevent spreading any germs you might have. #utcovid19  If you don't have a mask, you can order one for free here:  https://t.co/peLex8HFfL  https://t.co/de075Q1vHx

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We have been tracking data across Utah, and working closely with local health departments to understand how COVID-19 is impacting our communities. Saturday morning at 12:01, much of the state will transition to low-risk, or yellow. #utcovid19 Guidelines for individuals here:  https://t.co/0XjTxEKNCT

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We're working to gather more information on how COVID-19 is spreading in Utah, and @UofUHealth's new randomized antibody testing will help give us a better understanding of how the virus has impacted our communities.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The transmission of COVID-19 in Utah is currently less than 1:1, and our hospital capacity is in good shape. Our supplies of PPE are now robust, where they were once in short supply. #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Today is the first day of Utah's moderate risk phase in our fight against COVID-19. Read more about what this means for your family, friends, workplace, or business here:    https://t.co/VnGxp8RRY7  #utcovid19 #TogetherUtah

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Doing the little things makes a difference. All of us working together to take precautions can make a big difference in slowing the spread of COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: - RED indicates a HIGH RISK,  - ORANGE indicates MODERATE RISK,  - YELLOW would show a LOW RISK, and  - GREEN indicates what we might call our “NEW NORMAL RISK” for COVID-19, meaning, even in green, all of us need to exercise caution and care.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: With the help of @UofUHealth and ARUP, we are putting in place large-scale prevalence and incidence studies to understand Utah's exposure to COVID-19, as well as focused antibody testing to deploy to healthcare, frontline workers, and critical infrastructure workers.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We have greatly increase our capacity to test and trace for COVID-19. We can currently conduct 6,000 tests per day, and we can do lab work for 9,000 tests per day.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Whenever someone tests positive for COVID-19, experts at @UtahDepOfHealth contact them to help identify other people they may have infected, so we can reach out to close contacts.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Testing is crucial to identifying where COVID-19 is spreading, and how much spread we have in our communities. Download the Healthy Together app to assess your symptoms and locate testing centers.  https://t.co/3kR8gU45Jd

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: - Statewide non-ICU bed utilization is currently at 5% - There is demand to treat non-COVID-19 medical issues to ensure individuals are getting the medical help needed. This demand can be managed based on current hospital utilization

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I work with other state officials daily to review key health indicators related to COVID-19 in order to determine the wisdom of adjusting current directives and orders.   We’re glad those who need medical procedures are now better able to get the medical attention they need.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Today I am announcing the formation of the Utah Multicultural Task Force Subcommittee, which will serve as part of Utah’s COVID-19 Community Task Force. #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: What does Healthy Together do?  -It helps you track symptoms -It connects you with COVID-19 testing -It can help public health identify potential cases by providing additional information to enhance contact tracing efforts #utcovid19 #togetherutah  https://t.co/H8QNCUlZqw

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: @dowdyjk @UtahDepOfHealth You can choose to share location and bluetooth data in the app if you want to. If you do, that data will only be available to public health, who will still call you to work through contact tracing and other advice, if you test positive for COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: You can download the Healthy Together beta app today to track symptoms, and connect easily with COVID-19 testing throughout the state. Location data gathered through this app will also help @UtahDepOfHealth identify where COVID-19 is spreading.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We care about the privacy and security of Utahns' data, which is why:  - Use of the app is strictly opt-in and voluntary -Users own their data and can delete their data at any time.  -Only data that is required to combat COVID-19 will be shared with public health officials.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Today I am announcing a new tool for Utahns — the Healthy Together App. This mobile app will help you and your loved ones track symptoms, and connect easily with COVID-19 testing throughout the state.  https://t.co/5dUMyktTH3

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We are making significant headway in the battle against COVID-19 thanks to Utahns working together and following directions from @UtahDepOfHealth. I feel cautiously optimistic about the trends we are observing.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Inspiring to see our state come together to fight COVID-19. Thank you to @joshjames and the team of people at @siliconslopes who came together to bring 8 million pieces of PPE to Utah. #TogetherUtah  https://t.co/pLofvIC9MT

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We are encouraged by the COVID-19 data we are seeing so far, and we are making plans for how and when we will lift some restrictions. But Utah is still in an urgent response phase, and we will be for some time. Continue to follow guidance to #StaySafeStayHome. #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We are tracking COVID-19 data closely in Utah and we are encouraged by the trends we see so far. We will continue making data-driven decisions to #FlattenTheCurve and save lives.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Just visited with Navajo Nation @NNPrezNez and @NNVPLizer2019 on their efforts to fight COVID-19.  Utah is committed to working with the Tribe to assist our Navajo Tribal Members who live in Utah (w/ @SpencerJCox).

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: @lindsnelson8 @SpencerJCox We're at this point now. If you have ANY of the symptoms of COVID-19, we have enough tests to test you, and we want to test you. Try calling 1-800-456-7707 or visit  https://t.co/SFfv6LysCL.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The form takes about five minutes to fill out, and we ask those entering the state to pull over to complete it. Information gathered from the form will be provided to @UtahDepOfHealth to help track potential cases of COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: At 12:37 p.m. today, we activated a geotargeted electronic alert at Utah's borders. When motorists cross the border, they will receive a text message asking them to fill out a COVID-19 declaration.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Today my family and I are participating in a worldwide fast in hope that the world may be healed from the COVID-19 pandemic. Whether or not you are religious, let us all join together in a united effort as we look for miracles in the face of this pandemic.  https://t.co/tARhtmeqMa

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: All of Utah's National Parks are now closed to the public to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in neighboring communities.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Wearing masks in public is a good way to help slow the spread of COVID-19, particularly in situations where it can be difficult to maintain appropriate social distancing, like at the grocery store.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Do you have symptoms of COVID-19? Take the assessment at  https://t.co/SFfv6LysCL to find out if you need to seek testing. The more people get tested, the better we can control our outbreak.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: See this thread for more details on Utah's required COVID-19 travel declaration for those entering the state.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The order will go into effect on Friday. The travel declaration will ask individuals if they have been tested for COVID-19 and if they are experiencing any symptoms of coronavirus. It also asks where they have recently been traveling.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I am issuing an order this week in advance of Easter weekend requiring all individuals who are 18 years or older to complete a COVID-19 travel declaration form when entering our state. This will be required at the airport, and on our roadways. #utcovid19 #StaySafe #StayHome

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Utah's comprehensive plan for responding to COVID-19 is based on data. We're grateful to all who are contributing to that data, and helping us process it to make wise decisions for the state. We are still in the urgent phase of our response. #utcovid19

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Just finished a productive visit with Dr. Anthony Fauci about the actions and results from Utah’s Stay Safe Stay Home directive to slow the spread of the COVID-19 virus. Fauci expressed how favorably impressed he was with Utah’s comprehensive response.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The State has not taken over distribution of hydroxychloroquine, though high demand may be creating shortages. You can see @UtahDepOfHealth's recommendations for COVID-19 patients here:  https://t.co/il8Mze79pA

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Let me be clear about what is expected and required of us all, if we want to slow the spread of COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: If you have COVID-19 concerns or think you need a test, first, stay home. Use online resources or call 800-456-7707. For moderate to severe symptoms, find a testing facility in your community. Visit  https://t.co/OHttfLOuBd for more info. #StayHome

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We’re grateful to have #TestUtah up and running. Visit  https://t.co/SFfv6LysCL to take an assessment to see if you should be tested for COVID-19. We hope to have tests for everyone who wants them soon — but right now, we are focusing on testing those who are symptomatic.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Think you need to be tested for COVID-19? Visit  https://t.co/SFfv6LysCL for a new way to be tested. Together, we can #testutah, and we will get through this together. Next up, I challenge @PostMalone @UtahCoachWhitt @SenMikeLee & @TraegerGrills.  https://t.co/9EhXHaiccI

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Over the last few weeks, I have been so impressed with our #Utah media. Utahns are staying informed because of how you are covering COVID-19. You are another example of #OneUtah leading together. @DeseretNews @sltrib @kslnewsradio @fox13 @KUTV2News @abc4utah @pbsutah @KUER

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: You can also still test through @UHealth and @Intermountain. Together, we will continue dramatically increasing the capacity to test for COVID-19 in Utah.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Grateful to our friends at @UBusiness for putting together this free seminar. Utah is still in the urgent phase of responding to COVID-19, but together, we can adapt, innovate, and overcome. #TogetherUtah

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: To be clear: This is only a temporary moratorium on residential evictions for tenants directly impacted by COVID-19. People who can pay their rent now should do so immediately. Those who cannot pay now will be required to pay current and back rent when the order expires.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: This deferral applies specifically to people who experience financial losses tied to COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We continue to focus on increasing Utah's testing capacity. You do not need to have a known exposure to COVID-19, or to have traveled recently to get tested. You only need to have symptoms. Learn more about testing locations here:

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Utah is staying home for two weeks to prevent the spread of COVID-19.  Learn more about what the Stay Safe, Stay Home directive means for you and your family:   https://t.co/m2OrT2GLzT

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Utah has prepared a comprehensive economic plan to accompany our public health response to COVID-19. We're working to protect lives and livelihoods. You can view the plan at  https://t.co/2ZjSXBoXAw. #OneUtah  https://t.co/tzncgjIU0c

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Effective tomorrow, March 25, @UtahDepOfHealth is restricting nonessential medical, dental, and veterinary procedures to conserve protective equipment needed by doctors treating patients with COVID-19. Visit  https://t.co/mWyLPYyoMP to learn more about donating PPE.  https://t.co/I1B8me0App

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: After careful review, we have decided to extend Utah’s K-12 dismissal to help slow the spread of COVID-19. Instructors will continue teaching remotely through May 1st.  https://t.co/nfo1p7re9r

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: As missionaries return home due to the spread of COVID-19 across the globe, they should not be met by big groups of family or friends. Large welcome parties are dangerous and could greatly increase the spread of coronavirus in our state.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Utah is taking quick action to adjust tax filing and payment deadlines in response to the COVID-19 outbreak. More details to come. #utpol

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Wishing @RepBenMcAdams a quick and full recovery (and glad to see him exercising proper precautions - isolating at the sign of COVID-19 symptoms and calling his doctor before visiting a clinic).

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Tune in tonight to hear experts answer your questions about COVID-19, and to hear my message to Utahns at this time. #utahcoronavirus #utahearthquake

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: If someone in your home tests positive for COVID-19, everyone in your household should self isolate. This will greatly slow how quickly the virus spreads.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: The order also issues additional instructions to restaurants — to add sanitation precautions and check employees for symptoms of COVID-19 at the beginning of each shift.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Social distancing is one of the most important things we can do to slow the spread of COVID-19. Today’s order is focused on that.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We also have a full-time team focusing on increasing Utah’s capacity to test for COVID-19. We're working on getting more tests, and more chemicals to process those tests.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: With the increasing number of COVID-19 cases in our communities, we must take quick action to adjust and adapt in our daily lives to limit the spread of the virus.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Good news for Utah business owners impacted by COVID-19 — loans are now available to help you. Visit   https://t.co/7JY8lJKHfv and  https://t.co/IKT96tOrdM to learn more.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: We now have a known case of community spread of COVID-19. Following the social distancing procedures we introduced this week will help slow viral spread - so will practicing good hygiene and staying home when you are sick. Use common sense, and take care of each other.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: In addition, I am asking Local Health Departments to protect high-risk populations by requiring long-term care and other care facilities to restrict access and monitor employees and visitors for symptoms of COVID-19.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: In conjunction with the Utah COVID-19 Community Task Force, and Local Departments of Health we recommend the following measures to help slow the spread of COVID-19:

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Utah's third confirmed case was tested when they called their clinician, who identified they were at-risk for COVID-19. They were then tested curbside using an ARUP test. Testing capacity is increasing and streamlining in Utah -- more details on that soon.

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: Earlier this afternoon, I declared a state of emergency to help Utah prepare for diagnoses of COVID-19 in our state. This means we are in a state of readiness. Watch this video to learn more. #utahcovid19  https://t.co/t21qO3Yr75

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: I just signed an Executive Order declaring a state of emergency to help Utah prepare for potential diagnoses of COVID-19. We are in a state of readiness. #utahcovid19  https://t.co/uflUVirPUc

name: Gary R. Herbert
tweet: .@UDOH announced today that our state lab is ready to begin testing for COVID-19, beginning with patients who are at a high risk for infection.
